body.p:
To his excellency Thomas E Bramlett
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner Wm B Davis Rispectfully represents to your excellency that at the present term of the Whitley Circuit Court he was indited for having acted as bar Keeper for himself James Cutberth & M M Ellison without being Sworn as the Law requires ^and that he intend his appearance & plead guilty and was fined $20 -- ^ he States that in consequence of the reble raids into Whitley County the publick books had not been sent into Whitley County and as petitioner consequently he did not know that he Should be Sworn nor did he Cutberth Knew it He asks therefore that your excellency interpose your pardoning power and remit Said fine he State Jas Cutberth had taken out a license to keep a tavern W B Davis Says the Statements of the foregoing petition are true
Sworn to before me by W B Davis this 6th day of April 1864
Gov Bramlette I believe W B Davis violated the Law innocently he is a good citizen and I think you would do right to remit his fine

H T. Tinchy
J. C. Watkins clk

the petitioner Wm Davis is a first rate good citizen and I am satisfied that he did not know that he was violating the law when he sold the Whiskey the Law is a very recent one and Scarcely any one knows it please remit the fine
We know that the statements above made by his Honor Judge Pearl are true Mr Davis is a near neighbor to us & a good citizen and

R. Boyd
W C Murphy
J. L. Gatliff
W. L. Cook
H. L. Tye
A. C. King
J L McCarty S W C

Whitley Cir Ct
vs
W B Downs
